website_summaries.verdict: It looks good, it works well and is sturdy. Aside from battery life issues, the pros outweigh the cons.
pros: Compact unit with a tempered glass surface
Accurate and well-calibrated, with a large, backlit display
cons: Fingerprints are an issue - it's hard to keep the unit clean
Battery life is short, and it runs on lithium batteries
Controls and scale are both quite sensitive

customer_reviews.title: My Ozeri Pronto Touch was a lot better, in fact
customer_reviews.text: I definitely don't care for this scale. My Ozeri Pronto Touch was a lot better, in fact, I still use it over this one ALL THE TIME. This specific scale does not seem precise as the numbers bounce back and forth, and constantly are changing. It's SUPER sensitive. Oh and the battery died a LOT faster than my other scales.
customer_reviews.author: Solange

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot for weighing tiny kittens. I recently fostered a litter of 9 newborns. They needed to be weighed at least once a day to make sure they were gaining. It's hard work for a momma cat to raise 9 kittens even with a couple of humans to help. This scale was a great help. I put a bowl on the scale, zeroed it out and weighed the kittens in grams. As they got bigger I could start weighing them in ounces. I have also used it weigh pounds of butter, or nuts for cooking. The batteries last a long time too.
customer_reviews.author: Radical

customer_reviews.title: Rather inaccurate & difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Good things: looks good. Very modem look, slick. The black tempered glass surface is very nice and easy to clean. Bad things: It is rather difficult to use, especially the TARE function. The function is combined with the ON/OFF power button. So, a lot of times, it is a tedious guess work: one or two quick taps. If the finger stayed on the power area a bit too long, then the scale will be turned off. Inaccurate. An weight of around 13 g ground coffee will be measured for 13, 14 and 15 with three tries. The lesson is: if TART function is important, buy a scale with a dedicated button for the function. This scale is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L.

customer_reviews.title: Just the right type of scale I need
customer_reviews.text: I recently started portion control and needed a good digital kitchen scale that would correctly balance my portions This scale does it all I like the Precison Tare part where it calculates the correct net weight of ingredients I need unlike those plastic scales It's very easy to operate with touch sensitive buttons and easy to clean the tampered glass The style and width is very nice and the LCD functions are very clear It takes up little space on my counter which is a plus I will be buying a second one as this one works beautifully and is just what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Christine Mele

customer_reviews.title: This is my GO TO kitchen scale
customer_reviews.text: In order for me to diet properly, I have to weigh everything I eat, and I mean everything ~ this is the scale I rely on for each and every meal ~ I have actually ordered 3 now, my original, which my daughter in law fell in love with and took home, the second, to replace the one I gave her, and a third because we bought a little vacation cottage and I can't be anywhere without it, not even on vacation!
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Nation

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful. Accurate. Backlit. (But). Tare unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful. Super accurate. Backlit. batteries last 8 -12 months eith 4-7x daily use - as experienced over three different replacements. (Reviews on battery life are mixed likely because of stale batteries, not the scale). Why the two stars? Tare button doesn't work. Which means adding or weighing something new requires you to reset the scale (a 10 second process). Every. Single. Time. The former version of the same model never worked. This one seems to work about 1/7 times. I've added a video to illustrate. A complete shame. The only other that's sinilar in style is the Escali Arti, but it has no backlight.
customer_reviews.author: No Problem

customer_reviews.title: Accurate scale for the kitchen that is built for a pro.
customer_reviews.text: The things I like about this Ozeri Kitchen Scale are that it looks nice in the kitchen. I don’t have to hide it. It cleans very easily, so if you have to weigh food like chicken, then you can sanitize it. It’s lightweight, but is a very powerful and accurate scale that measures ounces, fluid ounces, grams, pounds. The tare setting allows you to measure things in a bowl and it adjust for the weight of the bowl. It was easy to set up and easy to use. I use it most for fresh herbs.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This scale works exactly as expected. It's very nice quality and feels like it will last for some time. I have found it to be highly consistent in weight measurements regardless of where on the surface the items are placed. I love the large weighing surface, as you can place a fairly large bowl on there without any trouble and can still see the read outs. Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase. It looks and feels high quality, and so far has returned highly accurate and consistent results. I would definitely recommend this scale to others. UPDATE 8/5/2018: I'm still using this scale regularly 4 years later. It still performs flawlessly and looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: VStevens

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scale to measure coffee for espresso machine. Since I have never calibrated the scale, I can't really say how exact the scale is. However, I have used the scale for two years now and I am happy with its consistency. Each morning I place my portafilter on the scale and it reads 439 grams, I zero the scale and weigh my coffee out. I get consistent brews. The scale is easy to use and I have only replaced the batteries once in two years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Montanaguy

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this scale but it is inaccurate and frustrating to ...
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this scale but it is inaccurate and frustrating to use. I dont believe it is calibrated at all because every time I put an item on it comes up completely inaccurate!! I have tried this with items I know the weight to and it comes up way under what it should be. Also if you move your item a little to the left or a little to the right and the weight completely changes. This scale is very frustrating to use and is completely defective, it is going back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Bad battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible battery life and uses the CR25 batteries which are expensive and a pain when the batteries die and you don't have a case of them for back up. Battery dies out after a month even if you don't use it everyday. Don't waste your money. Buy the Escali primo digital kitchen scale. I used that everyday at work for hours and replaced the AA batteries only once every 6 months
customer_reviews.author: NYCgirl333

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, not very precise
customer_reviews.text: This scale is easy enough to use. It isn't very precise though, and would definitely not be good for someone who wants to use it for baking. If you're just trying to use it for calorie counting, though, it will probably be fine. But it's just okay. I also noticed that I just stopped using it after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Sondergeld

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for meal prep
customer_reviews.text: We have been doing meal prep for dieting and needed a scale to measure portions. This was perfect. It’s really good quality and so far we have found it to be completely accurate. My husband went through and found things that were measured on a different scale and checked to make sure it all matches. It also comes with a really cool little book that tells you the calories in each portion measurement.
customer_reviews.author: SCL

customer_reviews.title: Exactly Exact
customer_reviews.text: It looks just like it looks here. It is sleek, like an ipad. Same finish. The buttons are actually touch sensitive, just diagrams really. Must be on a very flat surface and without imperfections. Raising and lowering physically by millimeters affects digital weight measurement. Highly, highly sensitive. All a plus, in my opinion. This scale is exact. I purchased .5, 1, 2, & 3 oz. sinkers for LST weights, a cannabis term, and not only are those exactly exact, but so is my new bad a 4-way weighing, backlit i might add, happily owned device. If only it controlled my home heat : )
customer_reviews.author: Jon O.

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works, not sure it’s accurate
customer_reviews.text: This scale was working great when we first got it aside from a few weird errors. Now almost every time I turn it on it gives me weird error messages, and I have to fiddle with it. It also doesn’t seem accurate - I’ll measure something, and after a few seconds the weight will start changing. Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Hafer

customer_reviews.title: Touch sensitivity is poor; unresponsive TARE button
customer_reviews.text: While the design is elegant and looks very modern, the device is terrible. Perhaps I got a bad unit? Eerything seems to love this scale, but for me, it does not function well. The main problem I experience was that the TARE function was unresponsive. I had to try at least 5 times to get it to tare. I tried washing my hands prior as well in case the touch sensitivity was finicky. Overall, the product is unsatisfactory due to the unresponsiveness of a critical function (TARE)
customer_reviews.author: Zeejet

customer_reviews.title: Unless you have an unlimited supply of (expensive) batteries, don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: This scale was clearly designed by someone who has never had to actually use a kitchen scale. In the little more than a year I have had this scale, I have spent more on replacement batteries than the original product. INSANELY, the auto-shutoff function does not take into consideration whether or not the scale is still in use. So, if you're actually using your scale for more than 2 minutes--whether adding additional ingredients to a bowl or making pour-over coffee--the scale will shut-off without warning in the middle of adding more weight. Pure nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: cjs

customer_reviews.title: putting back on and lo and behold things are just fine. No idea what is causing this
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Seems to be very accurate and precise. -Responsive. Cons: -Shuts off without warning. This makes pourover coffee a real gamble if you aren't paying close attention to the last recorded weight as the scale will tare when turned back on. -Gives instability error "out2" with perfectly stable objects on a flat surface. Very frustrating. This will mean stopping, taking coffee receptacle off, putting back on and lo and behold things are just fine. No idea what is causing this. -Seems to be a 1 or 2 minute automatic shutoff -- wish it were more like 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are frustrating to work with and it never sits quite flat on a counter. I found that it was difficult to tare out containers because the button didn't always work and sometimes picked up the force from the button press so when I tared it out it would zero out to a negative number. It also broke after a few years of not too frequent use, I put took a container off the surface to mix it and then when I put it back it read EEEE. I tried to follow the directions to re-calibrate it but that didn't work. I suppose it is worth the cost, but I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Houck

customer_reviews.title: ** PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW **
customer_reviews.text: ***********PLEASE READ ****************** Had to return this scale. I always calibrate my scales with a 100g then 200g weight. This scale could not accurately weigh either. Removing the batteries is the ONLY way to calibrate it, and it helped a LITTLE, but (depending on where I placed the weight) the scale still could not weigh the calibration weights accurately - It read anywhere from 197 - 208 for the 200g scale depending on where I placed it on the pad. Sad. Looks great, but not accurate. YMMV but Caveat emptor. UPDATE: I added one star solely for the amazing customer service. I predict that they could probably furnish me with an accurate scale, but I'm not sold on this technology.
customer_reviews.author: barxinu

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first, until months later when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well at first, until months later when it started to malfunction when turned on. Many times when I turned it on the screen would a random string of numbers and wouldn't tare. Prior to the malfunction my only complaint was the amount would change or lag. I typically used the scale for my Chemex coffee and it seemed to have a difficult time measuring the water.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very dissappointed!
customer_reviews.text: This scale is very nice and sleek looking but I was very dissapointed on this scale. I bought it to use while making wax melts but unfortunately it didnt work 4 out of 5 times pushing the button and when it did come on i put a 3 pound bag of wax on it and it only showed a little over 1 pound then kept going up and down constant like a glitch, Not worth it. I Wished i got a better scale. However, it did ship right on time. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Ashleys

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I like this product! I only wish the tare button and power button were different. Sometimes I just want to tare it and it shuts off :( however, for the price point, it’s fantastic! Maybe the next model of this scale will have a 3rd button to tare
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: Handy addition to any kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to use scale provides a multitude of options as far as weights and measures. Great for measuring weights and volumes of food when counting calories. Who really knows what a 2 ounce serving of pasta is? Takes the guesswork out of weight management when dieting. This scale is also handy to have for weighing small packages for shipping. As it is possible to purchase postage online, this makes shipping things to family members a snap. Weigh the package and there is no guess work to know how much shipping costs will be.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wehl

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice But Its Accuracy is Questionable
customer_reviews.text: I really really want to love this scale, but unfortunately it's not letting me to. I love the sleek design and how bright the display is. I also like the ease of being able to switch between units of measurement. Unfortunately, like many people have complained, this scale isn't always accurate which naturally defeats the purpose of having a scale. I read that there was a work around by placing what you're measuring in a container to distribute weight evenly, but that seems annoying, incredibly inconvenient, and a silly stipulation.
customer_reviews.author: Fadizzle

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking but not functional
customer_reviews.text: Owned an older version of this product and was satisfied but when I needed a second scale I decided to grab this one. It looks very nice and sleek however there are a few design flaws. First the tare/on off button is not very responsive. When you go to tare our the scale it registers your finger as additional weight causing the tare to be off. My solution was to turn it off and turn it back on with the object on top. Second the battery life of my first scale is going strong however this one is already showing a low battery signal and the battery is not common/typically on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Ankeet

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but batteries drain fast.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product a few months back, and have been using it almost daily since, being sure to turn it off when I"m finished (maybe 5 mins per use) . I've had to replace the batteries countless times, and at this point I'm going to be getting a new scale as it's getting expensive. When it works it works just as it should. Accuracy is fine, only a little lag when weighing. I'm by no means unhappy, but just doesn't work as a daily driver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very slim and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this scale is the size. It is really slim and can be stored away very easily. It is easy to clean as the whole surface is flat panel which also makes it very sleek. Buttons are touch buttons and do not require pushing. And the tare function works great. The manual could use some improvement, there were no clear instructions on how to tare or power down the scale. To power down, just hold the power button for several seconds. To use the tare function, just tap the power button quickly and it will adjust the measurement shortly after being tapped. Overall it is a great scale, and I even purchased two additional ones as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: isnlohbommu

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent
customer_reviews.text: This product works but is not consistent with it's measurements. The battery type is annoying to find as well although it lasts a fair time. This thing is fine if you're looking for something cheap that will give you approximate weight but it sucks for consistency and accuracy. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel J. Capenos

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and fancy!💕
customer_reviews.text: So I picked up my Ozeri Kitchen Scale today and I loved how fancy it looked. I got it in black. I like how slim it is which makes it easy to set aside when not in use. I quickly tested the different weight options available as seen on the photos - ml, lb oz & g, and I was impressed on how accurate it is. I highly recommend this for measuring small portions in cooking.
customer_reviews.author: iammyx

customer_reviews.title: great design, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: great design, easy to use! very easy to store! i love that it's thin and flat, and can just slip in the side of my cupboard. i have a clear glass bowl that i set on the scale, tare it to zero, and then add my flour, or sugar or even chocolate chips. most of my baking recipes use weights, and it's easy to switch between oz and grams, too.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works well but power button is hypersensitive
customer_reviews.text: May 2020: Not only is the power button overly sensitive, the auto-shutoff is a pain. Let's say you're making cake and adding ingredients by weight. You pause while adding sugar and the scale thinks you're done and shuts off. It doesn't remember the previous weight so you now don't know how much sugar you've added and how much more to add. It does chew through batteries quickly. Previous review: Use it often and like it a lot with one caveat: the power button is easily turned on and off by light touches. The manufacturer could improve the scale by making the power button a mechanical one.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Although pretty, I am returning this scale. Even though it has many good reviews, it has an extremely short shut off time. You had better have all the ingredients you want to weigh ready, before you start weighing them. We had a similar scale and they also have a very short battery life. Until my husband reminded me, I forgot about our previous scale and being a sucker for the sleek looks bought another one. My husband weighs everything and really dislikes this scale. We have a not as nice looking Tanita with a long shut of time and also a long battery life, which we very much like.
customer_reviews.author: Seaotter or Hubby

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice. I absolutely hate the touch screen buttons
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. I absolutely hate the touch screen buttons. My last two scales have been real buttons and work sooo much better. This one I have to touch the screen multiple times sometimes to get it to where I want, it also is delayed. It takes a second to tare and when I’m weighing small amounts of powders in grams it’s super frustrating because it is so delayed I over pour every time! 😡
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a great scale of food service.
customer_reviews.text: As I just got this scale I can't comment on its durability, but in using it the first time it has some really great features, It is thin flat and easy to store, it zeros every time you turn it on, and if it gets a false reading all you need to do is turn it off then on again. I would zero it with a piece of celophane on it to weigh meat for half pound burgers. it worked perfectly. Also it is very easy to clean, and has little rubber feet on the bottom so it doesn't slide around on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gough

customer_reviews.title: Zero stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: I got the scale two years ago as a gift from a friend. I only used it once but recently took it out of the box again so I could start measuring my food for my macros. For whatever reason it said LO so I changed the battery and it won’t even come on! I tried several times making sure it was loaded correctly but it won’t even turn on. Also add that removing the old batteries was tricky. It looks really nice and fancy but it does not hold up well. So now I’m out to get a new scale but it will definitely not be this Brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Elegant piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is a pathetic excuse for a scale; just more C grade goods that has inflated reviews. Without any prompting, it will increase and fall between weights as if there was actual adding and taking away the weight. The only point of a scale is to accurately weigh items and the Ozeri Touch misses the mark by not functioning properly. It makes for a beautiful spoon holder though.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor McCarra

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, easy to clean and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a month now and use it often in my baking. The scale appears to be accurate to within one gram. Sometimes it will flip between grams as if the weight is exactly at the halfway mark between one gram and the next, but it usually is rock solid. Super easy to clean and a no-brainer to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: There's no blue back light as shown in the picture. The readings are in accurate. I'll weigh something and the weight will set. If I leave it for a few more seconds it will change again. I weighed a few shrimp, took one piece out put it back in and the weight was not the same as the first time. I needed my weights to be exact. I returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good food scale. We weigh almost everything we eat. This is my second one because I wanted another to leave at our lake house. I've had the other one for about 3 years. The battery is still working and it has never malfunctioned. It is very easy to use and it is easy to see the large numbers. It is wonderful for portion control and we have lost weight and maintained it by using this. We had no idea what a 4 ounce piece of fish was until we weighed it. You won't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great scale and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice scale! Love how thin it is and how easy it is to store it. I love all the settings it has so you can weigh many different types of things. Highly recommend this scale look no further and order!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outweighs others in its class
customer_reviews.text: This product's design is great. I can leave it on the counter and not have an ugly, bulky thing just taking up space. It is very accurate, down to .01 of a gram. There are many different units of weight to choose from. This comes with batteries and is very easy to use. User manual is in several languages to help many customers. Great scale compared to others in the same price bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life and short timeout
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this scale. It shuts off automatically after two minutes if it doesn’t see an abrupt change in weight. I primarily use it for making pour over coffee, and have to lift the cup off of the scale midway through to prevent it from shutting off before I’m done brewing. In spite of this overly aggressive power saving measure, the battery life is very poor; I use it at most once a day for about three minutes and find that the batteries only last for two months. You will likely be better served by another scale.
customer_reviews.author: Carl D Tappan

customer_reviews.title: The scale works fine except for one huge design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The scale works fine except for one huge design flaw. If you're gonna be weighing things here and there, I'd say this is like a 5 star product. But if you're gonna be cooking things in bulk for the week, and constantly need to measure things out, this is like 3 stars. The reason being is because the buttons do not work when you get your hands wet or water on the scale. There's pretty much nothing that can be done about it since it's an inherent design flaw. But I would definitely advise looking elsewhere if you're gonna use this a lot in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: bigDee

customer_reviews.title: No, no, no
customer_reviews.text: This was broken right out of the box. I tested it several times and it was inaccurate every time. At one point it wouldn’t even register any weight on it. I regret the purchase and can’t believe I threw the box away trusting it would work before I actually tested it.
customer_reviews.author: reading

customer_reviews.title: when I first started using it it was terrific very consistent seem to be excellent however in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the scale two months ago, when I first started using it it was terrific very consistent seem to be excellent however in the last three weeks it's no longer be working well at all, when I put something on the scale and leave it there for 10 to 15 seconds the weight changes every 2 to 3 seconds. for example I put a one cup plastic container on there which should weigh .4, and I watch the scale go from .4 to .5 to .6, it just kept going up and this is happening with everything i put on the scale. Of course the window to return the scale is over!!! I would not recommend the scale !!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara s.

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy, does not work as stated; defective LCD display
customer_reviews.text: The LCD readout segments were apparently defective. This gave incomprehensible reading when weighing pounds. Tare operation very glitchy, sometimes took several attempts to achieve a zero reading with container on the scale. I was disappointed because this unit was to replace my ten plus years old Ozeri scale with which I was very happy. Item returned for refund. I am not giving up on Ozeri as I have ordered the Ozeri Touch II 18 lbs Digital Kitchen Scale, with Microban Antimicrobial Product Protection. Last chance, Ozeri!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mxyzptlk

customer_reviews.title: Great for weighing meals
customer_reviews.text: Great for weighing items quickly and somewhat accurately. The glass top is easy to clean which is a major plus in my book because I have had some scales that get very nasty in only a short period time. Make sure that you are weighing on a perfectly level surface! otherwise you will not got an accurate reading. The tare button is very finicky to the point where I wish it was an actual push button rather than touch.
customer_reviews.author: JonB

customer_reviews.title: Good Scale After Enhancements
customer_reviews.text: Good kitchen scale for the price. Decent sized platform so that the display can be still read with a bowl on top. My only complaint was the battery life. After a few times when the scale was needed and the batteries were dead, I removed the batteries and hard wired a spare AC/DC power supply to the battery contacts. No more batteries required and the scale is now always powered.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking scale that works fairly well
customer_reviews.text: Scale looks sleek and nice on the counter. Seems fairly accurate, but not perfect. Good enough for cooking, but I wouldn't use it for anything that requires high precision. I had a container+ingredients on at 545 grams, added 5 more grams to bring it to 550g; then took it off for a few minutes, and when I put it back on it said 545 grams again. only a 1% discrepancy, so it's tolerable certainly. Overall I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: So many uses
customer_reviews.text: I use my scale mostly for baking, but I've found other uses, as well. I've weighed letters for postage, measured chemicals for my pool and weighted out pre planned meals. The thing it is most helpful with is my knitting! I can weigh my skein and know when it's time to start binding off or change colors, etc. The scale stores easily, upright in the side of a cabinet. My last one was hard to store and usually had stuff piled on it, which wasn't so good for accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Burns

customer_reviews.title: Very nice scale - Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scale, accurate, if a little small for some large-size bowls. I mostly use it to weigh ingredients when baking- which really cuts down on dirty spoons, measuring cups, etc. The only issue I have is with the size which makes it sometimes awkward to get the scale to register the weight. You can't beat the price, and Ozeri makes great products. I've had this scale for a couple of months and it's still holding up well. Definitely buy this one if you're interested in purchasing a scale for baking!
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: A fine scale with some annoying features
customer_reviews.text: This scale works fine with doing rough, quick measurements. It’s absolutely not designed for anything that requires longer, changing measurements (like making pour over coffee, for example). The auto-off will seriously drive you insane. also, the batteries runs out fairly regularly and are annoying to replace, given that they are round, flat watch battery-type.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Divers

customer_reviews.title: Elegant Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: This stylish scale is more than functional, but it is an elegant touch to your kitchen. The opaque scale surface blends in with your kitchen decor. The ability to measure up to 11 pounds adds extra capacity to the run of the mill kitchen scales. The ability to measure both small and large quantities provides the chef with the information to prepare recipes to perfection. I have measure the accuracy and it appears to be dead on. I even used this scale to weigh a parcel post package, took the package to the Post Office and got the thumbs up on my postage. I highly recommend this Ozeri 11 pound scale.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Sarasota

customer_reviews.title: Shopping for a different scale.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this scale regularly for about a year. Pros: Lightweight, easy to tuck away, easy to clean, accurate. Cons: Terrible battery life, shuts off seemingly at random, and the face isn't tempered glass, as advertised, but plastic. This scale has been very frustrating to use, owing in part to the fact that there's no on/off switch. It activates with weight and has a timed auto-off. I am currently in the market for a replacement food scale.
customer_reviews.author: EricaFisher

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Clean
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I just tried baking by weight instead of by measurement, after having found converting gluten free recipes to be problematic. We love the Ozeri scale. My 10 year old had no problem learning to zero it with one touch and switch between units as needed. We measured a lot of different flours and the scale became quite messy but wiped down easily. We chose to store it back in its box and it was easy to pop the end protectors back on and slide it back in the box.

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and pretty, and seems to be working fine

customer_reviews.title: Trash

customer_reviews.title: Very good little kitchen scale

It's a little spring-operated plastic thing that went up to 1 pound with questionable accuracy. I had absolutely no idea what a modern one could do until I got the Ozeri 11 pound. It blows the doors off what we've been using! It even does postal weights, which had never entered our minds until we read the information booklet. That booklet, by the way, is also very helpful. I have Amazon Prime, so I had it in my hands in two days. Nice!

customer_reviews.title: sleek, functional scale

I wish it was red~ :) WIth black, people keep thinking it's an ipad or something! Also, thank you Ozeri for including batteries! It's so great when companies provide batteries to use right away.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie

customer_reviews.title: Elegant , yet simple design , great functionality , reasonable cost , arrived promptly , packaged safely .
customer_reviews.text: Seems accurate from less than 10 grams to over 10 pounds . Pounds and ounces is a nice feature ( e.g. 9 lb : 11 oz instead of 155 ounces ) in the choice of read outs ( grams , fluid ounces , pounds and ounces) , and tare correction also seems accurate even when using a hefty ceramic bowl to contain a much lighter ingredient . customer_reviews.author: Livin' in the 50s

customer_reviews.title: which is annoying if you go for precision

product_meta.title: Ozeri Touch Professional Digital Kitchen Scale (12 lbs Edition), Tempered Glass in Elegant Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackCombining new advanced touch sensitive buttons, a tempered glass surface, and new GFX sensors, the Ozeri Touch is one of the industry's most advanced digital kitchen scales. The Ozeri Touch Digital Kitchen Scale features an elegant reflective colored surface made out of high quality tempered glass that is 4 times stronger than normal glass. It includes 4 high-precision sensors to deliver superior accuracy and the fastest response times for the quick paced chef. The Ozeri Touch Digital Kitchen Scale combines all this technology into a contemporary thin design that stands out as a show piece for the modern kitchen. Designed for the culinary perfectionist who desires superior accuracy and a showpiece design, the Ozeri Touch is one of the lightest kitchen scales on the market and offers easy portability. The Ozeri Touch also features an automatic Tare button that quickly calculates the net weight of your ingredients by subtracting the container weight, whether the container is a bowl, tray or plate. The Ozeri Touch Digital Kitchen Scale has a capacity range from a mere 0.05 ounce to 12 pounds and 10.8 ounces (1 gram to 5750 grams), and provides measurements in graduations of 1 g or 0.05 oz on its bright LCD screen. The scale also displays results in both the US and international metric systems (grams | ounces | pounds | kilograms). The large screen features a new bright LCD with an improved viewing angle for the on-the-move chef, and provides Low Battery and Overload indicators. The Ozeri Touch Digital Kitchen Scale comes equipped with 2 removable Lithium batteries for extended life, and automatically powers off after 2 minutes of inactivity to preserve battery life.
